title: Bug 18028: Failure to Check Resource Write Permissions on Package Rename
description: When attempting to rename a package, the system fails to verify if all resources within the package are writable.
OB: While creating a package with a Code Unit (CU) and making the CU read-only, an attempt to rename the package results in an unexpected exception dialog.
EB: The system should perform a validation check before renaming a package to ensure that all resources, including any contained Code Units, are writable. If any resources are set to read-only, the rename operation should be prevented, and an appropriate notification should be provided.
SR:
1. Create a package containing a Code Unit (CU). 
2. Make the CU read-only. 
3. Attempt to rename the package.

Expected result: The system should prevent the rename operation and provide a notification about the read-only status of resources within the package.
